meanings.sent1: The tree stood stedfast in the ground, not budging even in the strong wind.
meanings.sent2: She held onto the railing stedfastly as she climbed the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The stedfast rock refused to roll down the hill, much to the frustration of the other rocks.
meanings.sent4: His stedfast loyalty to his friends never wavered, like a mountain unmoved by storms.
meanings.sent5: The stedfast gaze of the lighthouse guided ships safely through the night.

meanings.definition: Resolutely or dutifully firm and unwavering.
meanings.sent1: Despite the challenges, she remained stedfast in her decision to pursue her dreams.
meanings.sent2: The soldier stood stedfast in his duty to protect his country.
meanings.sent3: The stedfast cat refused to leave its spot on the warm windowsill, even when tempted with treats.
meanings.sent4: Her stedfast determination to learn the piano led her to practice diligently every day.
meanings.sent5: The stedfast commitment of the team members ensured the project's success.

meanings.sent1: The river flowed stedfastly towards the sea, never changing its course.
meanings.sent2: His stedfast gaze remained on the horizon, watching for any signs of movement.
meanings.sent3: The stedfast ticking of the clock echoed through the empty room, marking the passage of time.
meanings.sent4: The stedfast rhythm of the drums kept the marching band in perfect sync.
meanings.sent5: The stedfast routine of morning yoga helped her start each day with focus and calmness.
